unnormalised: Property registrations in Mumbai saw a jump of 15% YoY in Oct'23, with over 11,000 units registered. Experts are saying this is largely due to the festive season offers and the continued low interest rates. Apparently, many people prepone their purchase decisions during Diwali.
normalised: Property registrations in Mumbai saw a jump of fifteen percent year over year in October two thousand and twenty three, with over eleven thousand units registered. Experts are saying this is largely due to the festive season offers and the continued low interest rates. Apparently, many people prepone their purchase decisions during Diwali.

unnormalised: One developer, Acme Corp, is reporting that 60% of their sales were for 2BHK flats priced between Rs. 1.5 crore and Rs. 2.5 crore. Demand seems particularly high in the suburbs like Thane West and Kalyan, with property values appreciating by nearly 8% in the last 12 months. Sources suggest NRI investments are also contributing about 20% to the total sales volume.
normalised: One developer, A-c-m-e Corp, is reporting that sixty percent of their sales were for two B-H-K flats priced between rupee one point five crore and rupee two point five crore. Demand seems particularly high in the suburbs like Thane West and Kalyan, with property values appreciating by nearly eight percent in the last twelve months. Sources suggest N-R-I investments are also contributing about twenty percent to the total sales volume.

unnormalised: The average property price per sq ft in Mumbai is hovering around Rs. 25,000, according to a recent report by PropEquity. While some analysts predict a slight correction in Q1 2024, most believe the market will remain buoyant, fuelled by infrastructure projects like the Coastal Road and Navi Mumbai International Airport, which are slated to be completed by Dec'24.
normalised: The average property price per square foot in Mumbai is hovering around rupee twenty five thousand, according to a recent report by Prop Equity. While some analysts predict a slight correction in Q one two thousand and twenty four, most believe the market will remain buoyant, fuelled by infrastructure projects like the Coastal Road and Navi Mumbai International Airport, which are slated to be completed by December two thousand and twenty four.
